metadata.title: CVE-2019-13590 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libsox.a in SoX 14.4.2. In sox-fmt.h (startreadfunction), there is an integer overflow on the result of integer addition(wraparound to 0) fed into the lsx_calloc macro that wraps malloc. When aNULL pointer is returned, it is used without a prior check that it is avalid pointer, leading to a NULL pointer dereference on lsx_readbuf informats_i.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox2 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
sox - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2').
